pullrequest.title: Move FindODE.cmake to ign-cmake from ign-physics

content.raw:
Before merging this into `ign-cmake`, there are a few changes we'll need to make to ensure that it conforms to the requirements of the `ign-cmake` find modules. I can make the changes myself, but it might be informative for me to explain them:

- After finding ODE, we need to call `include(IgnImportTarget)` and then the macro `ign_import_target(ODE)` This will create an imported target for ODE which we can link to, instead of linking to the full library paths. This allows all our packages to be relocatable.

- Instead of searching for both ODE and DrawStuff, we should put DrawStuff into its own find-module. If ODE inextricably depends on DrawStuff, then we should call `find_package` on DrawStuff inside of the ODE find-module.

- If we do not actually have any DrawStuff dependencies, then we should consider just throwing away the parts of the script that search for DrawStuff and not making a module for it at all.

Before merging this into ign-cmake, there are a few changes we'll need to make to ensure that it conforms to the requirements of the ign-cmake find modules. I can make the changes myself, but it might be informative for me to explain them:

  • After finding ODE, we need to call include(IgnImportTarget) and then the macro ign_import_target(ODE) This will create an imported target for ODE which we can link to, instead of linking to the full library paths. This allows all our packages to be relocatable.

  • Instead of searching for both ODE and DrawStuff, we should put DrawStuff into its own find-module. If ODE inextricably depends on DrawStuff, then we should call find_package on DrawStuff inside of the ODE find-module.

  • If we do not actually have any DrawStuff dependencies, then we should consider just throwing away the parts of the script that search for DrawStuff and not making a module for it at all.
